# Parse the argument (action|vpn_name) IFS='|' read -r action vpn_name <<< "$1"
if [ "$action" = "connect" ]; then echo "Connecting to VPN: $vpn_name" echo "Executing command: scutil --nc start \"$vpn_name\" --secret \"$VPN_SECRET\"" scutil --nc start "$vpn_name" --secret %up3r50n!c
if [ $? -eq 0 ]; then echo "Command executed successfully, checking connection status..." sleep 3
# Check actual connection status status=$(scutil --nc status "$vpn_name" 2>/dev/null | head -1) echo "Current status: $status"
if echo "$status" | grep -q "Connected"; then echo "Successfully connected to $vpn_name" elif echo "$status" | grep -q "Connecting"; then echo "VPN is connecting, please wait..." sleep 5 final_status=$(scutil --nc status "$vpn_name" 2>/dev/null | head -1) if echo "$final_status" | grep -q "Connected"; then echo "Successfully connected to $vpn_name" else echo "VPN connection timed out or failed" echo "Final status: $final_status" exit 1 fi else echo "VPN connection failed" echo "Status: $status" exit 1 fi else echo "Failed to execute connection command" exit 1 fi elif [ "$action" = "disconnect" ]; then echo "Disconnecting from VPN: $vpn_name" echo "Executing command: scutil --nc stop \"$vpn_name\"" scutil --nc stop "$vpn_name"
if [ $? -eq 0 ]; then echo "Command executed successfully, checking disconnection status..." sleep 2
status=$(scutil --nc status "$vpn_name" 2>/dev/null | head -1) echo "Current status: $status"
if echo "$status" | grep -q "Disconnected"; then echo "Successfully disconnected from $vpn_name" else echo "Disconnection may still be in progress" echo "Status: $status" fi else echo "Failed to execute disconnection command" exit 1 fi else echo "Invalid action: $action" exit 1 fi

# VPN Manager Script Filter query=$(echo "$1" | tr -s '[:blank:]' | tr '[:upper:]' '[:lower:]')
# Get list of VPN connections vpn_list=$(scutil --nc list 2>/dev/null)
echo "<?xml version='1.0'?>" echo "<items>"
if [ -z "$vpn_list" ]; then echo "<item arg='' valid='no'><title>No VPN connections found</title><subtitle>Make sure you have L2TP VPN connections configured in System Preferences</subtitle></item>" else # Parse VPN list echo "$vpn_list" | while IFS= read -r line; do # Skip empty lines if [ -z "$line" ]; then continue fi
# Extract VPN name (in quotes) vpn_name=$(echo "$line" | sed -n 's/.*"\([^"]*\)".*/\1/p')
if [ -z "$vpn_name" ]; then continue fi
# Check if query matches VPN name (case insensitive) if [ -z "$query" ] || echo "$vpn_name" | tr '[:upper:]' '[:lower:]' | grep -q "$query"; then # Get connection status status=$(scutil --nc status "$vpn_name" 2>/dev/null | head -1)
# Determine status and action if echo "$status" | grep -q "Connected"; then status_text="Connected" action="disconnect" action_text="Disconnect" icon="ðŸŸ¢" else status_text="Disconnected" action="connect" action_text="Connect" icon="ðŸ”´" fi
# Create argument with action and VPN name arg="${action}|${vpn_name}"
echo "<item arg='${arg}' valid='yes'>" echo "<title>${icon} ${vpn_name}</title>" echo "<subtitle>${status_text} - Press Enter to ${action_text}</subtitle>" echo "<icon>vpn.png</icon>" echo "</item>" fi done fi
echo "</items>"

# THESE VARIABLES MUST BE SET. SEE THE ONEUPDATER README FOR AN EXPLANATION OF EACH. readonly remote_info_plist='https://raw.githubusercontent.com/custom/vpn-controller/master/src/info.plist' readonly workflow_url='custom/vpn-controller' readonly download_type='github_release' readonly frequency_check='7'
# FROM HERE ON, CODE SHOULD BE LEFT UNTOUCHED! function abort { echo "${1}" >&2 exit 1 }
function url_exists { curl --silent --location --output /dev/null --fail --range 0-0 "${1}" }
function notification { readonly local notificator="$(find . -type d -name 'Notificator.app')" if [[ -n "${notificator}" ]]; then "${notificator}/Contents/Resources/Scripts/notificator" --message "${1}" --title "${alfred_workflow_name}" --subtitle 'A new version is available' return fi
readonly local terminal_notifier="$(find . -type f -name 'terminal-notifier')" if [[ -n "${terminal_notifier}" ]]; then "${terminal_notifier}" -title "${alfred_workflow_name}" -subtitle 'A new version is available' -message "${1}" return fi
osascript -e "display notification \"${1}\" with title \"${alfred_workflow_name}\" subtitle \"A new version is available\"" }
# Local sanity checks readonly local_info_plist='info.plist' readonly local_version="$(/usr/libexec/PlistBuddy -c 'print version' "${local_info_plist}")"
[[ -n "${local_version}" ]] || abort 'You need to set a workflow version in the configuration sheet.' [[ "${download_type}" =~ ^(direct|page|github_release)$ ]] || abort "'download_type' (${download_type}) needs to be one of 'direct', 'page', or 'github_release'." [[ "${frequency_check}" =~ ^[0-9]+$ ]] || abort "'frequency_check' (${frequency_check}) needs to be a number."
# Check for updates if [[ $(find "${local_info_plist}" -mtime +"${frequency_check}"d) ]]; then if ! url_exists "${remote_info_plist}"; then abort "'remote_info_plist' (${remote_info_plist}) appears to not be reachable."; fi # Remote sanity check
readonly tmp_file="$(mktemp)" curl --silent --location --output "${tmp_file}" "${remote_info_plist}" readonly remote_version="$(/usr/libexec/PlistBuddy -c 'print version' "${tmp_file}")"
if [[ "${local_version}" == "${remote_version}" ]]; then touch "${local_info_plist}" # Reset timer by touching local file exit 0 fi
if [[ "${download_type}" == 'page' ]]; then notification 'Opening download pageâ€¦' open "${workflow_url}" exit 0 fi
download_url="$([[ "${download_type}" == 'github_release' ]] && curl --silent "https://api.github.com/repos/${workflow_url}/releases/latest" | grep 'browser_download_url' | head -1 | sed -E 's/.*browser_download_url": "(.*)"/\1/' || echo "${workflow_url}")"
if url_exists "${download_url}"; then notification 'Downloading and installingâ€¦' curl --silent --location --output "${HOME}/Downloads/${alfred_workflow_name}.alfredworkflow" "${download_url}" open "${HOME}/Downloads/${alfred_workflow_name}.alfredworkflow" else abort "'workflow_url' (${download_url}) appears to not be reachable." fi fi
